documents.title: dempsey : foley rescue effort 'highest-risk mission ever '
text: dempsey is talking about the effort by american special forces to rescue james foley , the american journalist killed by isis last month .
having been at this some time , it was the most complex , highest risk mission we 've ever undertaken , dempsey says .
he says that might provide some solace to the family , which has complained that the us government did not offer them enough help .
graham : is there any doubt in your mind that if isil had the capability to kill millions of americans , they would do so ?
neither graham nor hagel doubts as much .
really it 's mankind against isil , graham says .
if you 're a christian in the region , they will kill you very quickly , is that correct ?
dempsey : unless you convert .
lindsey graham , republican of south carolina , asks dempsey what destroying isil would look like .
dempsey says isf and pesh must go offensive , regain lost territory ' while the government of iraq fills in behind with inclusive policies , then we restore the border .
i 'm with you , graham says , hurrying him along .
joe manchin , democrat of west virginia , questions the efficacy of the new us strategy , which he does not see as appreciably different from the old us strategy .
emptywheel ( @ emptywheel ) machin : our past performance for 13 years in that region have n't given us the results .
it seems like [ barbaric dictators ] are what rules in reply , dempsey says , we 've got a generational problem , which is to say a 20-year problem , in the wake of the so-called arab spring .
but with three years gone , it might now only be a 17-year problem , he says .
his solution is to get others not only to do some of the lifting , but to pay for it as well .
the idea here apparently is not that these three are chasing isis together .

dempsey says it will take 3-5 months to set up the program to train the 5,400 opposition troops in saudi arabia .
it will take 8-12 months to build a fighting force , he says .
they force will be mainly recruited from the displaced population .
in many cases they 've already been driven out of their homes or villages by isis or the regime , he says .
dempsey is talking about estimates of the number of isis fighters .
dempsey says the last number he saw was 31,000 but it 's an inexact science .
the number could count tribes who have been coopted , for example , and their hearts might not be in it , he says .
two-thirds of the isis forces are in syria , he says .

documents.title: dempsey : identifying moderate opposition not difficult
text: mark udall , democrat of colorado , asks with regard to training the syrian opposition , how does the dod define moderate ?
we 've learned a lot , dempsey says , because of the nonlethal assistance we 've provided .
because we 've had to make contact with certain groups in order to flow that assistance we 've come a long way in our ability to vet .
in terms of defining a moderate opposition , i do n't think that 'll be difficult , actually those who are radical in their ideologies have made their move .
those who are not have demonstrated great courage in resisting .
dempsey says the 5,400 before there was talk of 5,000 opposition fighters trained by the united states must answer to a syrian chain of command , not to the united states .
this ca n't just be a proxy force , dempsey says .
it appears from today 's testimony that there are scenarios under which the us would place american troops in combat roles to fight isis in iraq .

dempsey : `` he has told me to come back to him on a case by case basis . ''

he named retaking mosul as an example .
raising the question of what other possible missions would warrant active american participation .

dempsey says maliki had strong ideas about iraqi sovereignty and iran was on his side in preferring a us exit .

not an american project , he says .

does that mean the us wo n't have an available proxy force in syria for a whole year ?
hagel admits there 's a correlation there , between the training schedule and the deployment schedule .
another protester interrupts the hearing : the united states needs to get out of iraq , out of syria , stop the bodies !
who is in the coalition ?

hagel says he was n't there at the time .
dempsey says , senator , you know that i recommended at the time to train them but policy went in another direction .
mccain turns to border security .

for us to say that we are going to go in and only fight against isil you are n't going to get many troops to help you i guarantee you that .

gavel gavel gavel .

documents.title: dempsey : us troops could 'accompany ' local forces in combat
text: next up is jack reed , democrat of rhode island .
he asks dempsey what exactly our forces are doing in iraq today .
dempsey says it 's important to clarify that all us troops are combat capable , but that 's different from how we use them .
dempsey says us forces on the ground in iraq are in an advisory role .
but they could take a more active role in certain missions , such as retaking mosul in which case they might provide close combat advising or accompanying that mission .
that sounds a lot like a combat mission .
spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) `` close combat advising '' is dempsey 's term for us ground troops potentially accompanying iraqis/kurds in combat against isis .
watch this term

this point has been out there , but for clarity 's sake we 'll note , as hagel just has again , that the obama administration will ask for congressional authorization ie approval by vote for $ 500m to train and equip syrian opposition forces .
inhofe says he does n't want people to think that this is just one more counter-terrorism measure .
what does victory look like ? , he asks hagel .
hagel says victory would be when the mission is completed , which is degrading , destroying and defeating isil , just as the president laid out his objective .
inhofe asks dempsey : does he consider air missions to be a combat outing , and would the us military put boots on the ground in iraq or syria to rescue a downed pilot ?
yes , and yes , says dempsey .

dempsey says the map may not go far enough .

hagel says he does still believe that .

but we will do it right .
we will be able to train and equip these forces through our ability to give them the kind of equipment they need .

we recognize that .
as for isis numbers , those estimates float , hagel says .
it is hard to pinpoint at any one time what the strength of isil is .
he says isis up a lot of support recently , a lot of it being forced support .
the muslims of the world know that what isil represents is in no way what their religion , their ethnicity , their background represents , hagel says .
having local forces involved is the most significant thing we can do .

this is not a west-versus-east issue , hagel says .
the threat that is confronting them needs to be addressed by the people of their region to have arab and muslim be present and public about their presence in this coalition is indispensable .

dempsey says he personally supports the strategy because the threat will only be defeated when moderate arab and muslim populations in the region participate and that 's the us plan .
a bit of circular reasoning there .
while this work in iraq is taking place , we will simultaneously pressure isil in syria , dempsey says .
he says the united states will work to ensure there 's a syrian chain of command leading forces against isis militants .
this wo n't look like a shock-and-awe campaign because that 's not how isil is organized , but it will be a persistent campaign , dempsey says .
dempsey says he thinks isil will be defeated .
isil will ultimately be defeated when their cloak of religious [ piety ] is stripped away , he says .

you 're just breeding extremism !

documents.title: hagel : 'we are at war with isil '
text: the united states has allotted $ 186m in fy 2014 to help displaced people in iraq , and the us has committed $ 3bn in humanitarian assistance since the start of the civil war , hagel says .
this will not be an easy or a brief effort we are at war with isil , as we are with al-qaeda .
the united states will not coordinate or cooperate with the assad regime , hagel says .
hagel says us forces in iraq will operate out of baghdad and irbil , for a total of about 1,600 troops .
american forces will not have a combat mission , hagel says .
they will support iraqi and kurdish forces .
the best counterweight against isil are local forces , he says .

saudi arabia has agreed to host training grounds for more than 5,000 syrian opposition forces , who will be given small arms , vehicles and communications equipment and training , hagel says , and we would be prepared to provide increasingly sophisticated types of assistance .
a rigorous vetting process would be critical to the success of this program , hagel says .
there will always be risks , hagel says .
but we believe that risk is justified .

documents.title: hagel has approved plan for strikes inside syria
text: hagel turns to the us strategy .
we are broadening our air campaign against isil targets , he says .
the us has carried out more than 160 strikes .
the operations have disrupted isil , he says .
the iraqi people must be united against isil in order to defeat them , hagel says .
this is ultimately their fight .
he says kurdish forces will join the fight and work to retain territory taken back from isis .
us central command has a plan to take targeted actions against isil safe havens in syria , including striking infrastructure , hagel says .
general dempsey and i have both reviewed and approved the cent com plan .
hagel describes the coalition against isis .
hagel says isil is holding 46 turkish diplomats hostage .
he said turkey would make specific contributions to the fight against isis , as would six members of the gulf cooperation council and 22 members of the arab league .
we expect additional nations would begin making contributions across the spectrum , he says .
obama will chair a meeting of the un security council next week and discuss how to confront isis , hagel says .
isil now controls a vast swathe of eastern syria and western and northern iraq , gaining strength by exploiting the civil war in syria and sectarian strife in iraq , hagel says .

while isil clearly poses an immediate threat to americans in iraq and the middle east foreign fighters with western passports pose a separate danger , were they to travel to europe or the us , hagel says .
the intelligence community has not detected specific plotting , he says .
spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) hagel dialing back his aug 21 assessment of isis posing `` imminent threat to every interest we have , '' which inhofe pointedly praised him for .
hagel says obama is in atlanta to meet with cdc officials about ebola , and later flies to tampa , florida , to meet with central command about isis .
hagel will join the president there .
american military power alone can not , will not eradicate threats posed by isil , hagel says .
he says new iraqi leadership is required .
he says the administration believes the new iraqi premier , haider al-abadi , is committed to shaping an inclusive coalition to fight isis .
hagel says the administration has and will continue to consult with congress about what to do .
hagel begins .
he 's interrupted by protests from the room .
levin asks the protesters to go .
would you please now leave !
the american public does not want war , the protester says .
you 're acting very warlike yourself , levin ripostes .

it will take an army to defeat an army , he says .

the president 's plan of airstrikes and arming allies is destined for failure , he says , and his ruling out boots on the ground prompted a collective sigh of relief at isis headquarters in syria when they heard him say that .
but do n't get inhofe wrong .
to be clear , he says , i 'm not advocating combat divisions on the ground .

as for isis tripling in size , guardian us national security editor spencer ackerman points out that inhofe 's stats might be taken with a grain of salt : spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) inhofe cites 100-american-isis-fighters , though us intelligence officials say there are 100 americans in syria , not all fighting for isis .

ranking member inhofe begins with a familiar line of criticism against the administration , saying that after a year of white house indecision and hand-wringing , the president finally announced his strategy to defeat isis and it falls short : the administration continues to say no specific evidence of plots against the homeland exists .
now i want to remind everybody that we had no specific evidence of plots against the homeland before 9/11 .
well , there was that memo , bin laden determined to strike in us .
air strikes alone will not be sufficient to defeat isis , levin says .
doing so , he says , will take the participation of key arab states ; combat operations carried out by iraqis and syrians ; and bipartisan , bicameral congressional support including legislation .

the united states appears not to be the only one building a coalition : mukhtar ibrahim ( @ mukhtaryare ) breaking : al-qaeda 's branches in yemen ( aqap ) and north africa ( aqim ) urged jihadists in iraq & syria to unite against the us-led coalition .
protesters greet the defense secretary 's arrival in the hearing room .
no more war !
no more war !
they call out .
chairman levin gavels the session to order and begins his opening statement .

arab participation in us-led air strikes against isis will be symbolically important in diluting the impression of another american war in the middle east and showcasing the role being played by the sunni world in combating a vicious perversion of muslim values and an alarming threat to the status quo , guardian middle east editor ian black ( @ ian black ) writes : military capability is not a problem : saudi arabia , the uae and qatartogether have hundreds of advanced fighter aircraft , though the six-member gulf cooperation council ( gcc ) has next to no experience of coordination .
politically , however , fighting with the us would require greater determination than they have yet shown to tackle the jihadis who have sent shockwaves across the region .
offers of help most likely from the emiratis and saudis attest to the gravity of the situation .
washington may be cautious given that the iraqi military has extensive experience of working with the us but none with the gulf states .

documents.title: syrian military plane crashes into raqqa
text: a syrian military aircraft has crashed into raqqa , the de facto capital of islamic state ( isis ) , killing at least eight people , as thousands of residents fled to nearby villages in anticipation of expected us air strikes against the militants , activists said .

the associated press reports : it was not immediately clear whether the plane that slammed into the north-eastern city of raqqa was hit by anti-aircraft fire or experienced a technical failure , according to an activist based in the city and the britain-based syrian observatory for human rights on tuesday .
the activist , who goes by the name fourat alwfaa , said eight people were killed in the crash , including members of two families , after the aircraft ploughed into their home .
the observatory said there were casualties but did not have a concrete figure .
read the full piece here .

you can watch this morning 's hearing , called u.s. policy towards iraq and syria and the threat posed by the islamic state of iraq and the levant ( isil ) , on the senate armed services committee web site here .
the committee is chaired by carl levin , democrat of michigan , and the ranking member is james inhofe , republican of oklahoma .
starring members of the committee on the republican side include sens .
john mccain , lindsey graham and ted cruz , all of whom have been highly critical of the administration 's performance on iraq and syria .

the prospect of us air strikes on isis militants has civilians in the eastern syrian city of raqqa , where the western hostages slain by the islamic state ( isis ) terror group were held , waiting in fear , the guardian 's martin chulov ( @ martinchulov ) reports : i believe most of the casualties will be civilian , said abu mohammed , 33 , a shopkeeper .
the majority will be from raqqa and very few from isis .
many of our young men in the city have joined isis either because of fear or because of the wages they give , which is $ 400 ( â£ 246 ) per month .
this is a very good salary for us here .
abu mohammed said he had adapted to the group 's hardline rule and saw isis as a better option than the regime of bashar al-assad .
we are afraid that after the us air strikes , the regime will take control of the city .
assad is a criminal and his regime is brutal .
we had bad experience with the free syria army [ fsa ] , they are corrupt and now we are getting used to isis 's islamic rules .
day after day , they are getting better with people .
abu maya al-raqawi , 40 , a media worker from the city , said : some people are already fleeing the city as they know that civilians are going to be the real victims for these air strikes .
raqqa will be completely destroyed .
we all know that isis are spreading themselves among civilians and they occupy the fsa and old regime headquarters , which are in civilian areas .
people in raqqa have to deal with two evils , isis or assad .
which one is better ?
i do n't know the answer .

good morning and welcome to our live blog coverage of the first official testimony by defense secretary chuck hagel about the expanding us military offensive against isis militants in iraq and syria .
hagel is scheduled to testify alongside martin dempsey , the chairman of the joint chiefs of staff , before the senate armed services committee beginning at 9.30 am et .
the us offensive in iraq grew on monday with an air strike on an isis position southwest of baghdad , according to us central command .
it was recorded as the 162nd us air strike inside iraq since 8 august .
president obama announced last week that he had authorized strikes inside syria as well , and that he was sending 475 additional american troops to iraq , for a total of around 1,700 .

militants with isis the rapidly growing force that has declared a caliphate straddling the iraq-syria border released a video on saturday purporting to show the killing of british hostage david haines , an aid worker .
previous videos de the killing in cold blood of two american journalists .
polling indicates that americans favor a military confrontation with isis by a more-than-60 % majority .

hagel and dempsey are likely to face questions about what shape this confrontation will take , whether it can achieve the president 's objective to degrade and ultimately destroy isis , and what congressional approval may be sought or required .
guardian us national security editor spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) is covering today 's hearing .
we 'll bring you spencer 's coverage as it unfolds and rolling coverage from the committee room .
